title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A woman shoots her husband five times in the face and then never speaks again. A psychotherapist is determined to unravel her mystery.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: On their fifth wedding anniversary, Amy Dunne disappears, and her husband Nick becomes the prime suspect.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A disgraced journalist and a young female hacker team up to investigate the disappearance of a young woman from a wealthy family.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon and Sophie Neveu find themselves embroiled in a dangerous game of cat and mouse as they follow clues hidden within Da Vinci's artwork.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: Rachel, a woman struggling with alcoholism and a recent divorce, becomes obsessed with a seemingly perfect couple she observes from her train commute, only to become entangled in their mysterious disappearance.

title: The Reversal
author: Michael Connelly
description: Mickey Haller defends his half-brother, a convicted killer, in a retrial light-whited on DNA evidence, pitting him against his own Lincoln Lawyer persona.

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Fokley
description: On a remote island off the Irish coast, a wedding celebration turns deadly when someone turns up dead, and everyone is a suspect.

title: Before I Go To Sleep
author: S.J. Watson
description: Christine wakes up every morning with no memory of her past. As she tries to piece together her life, she uncovers a terrifying secret.

title: Dark Places
author: Gillian Flynn
description: Libby Day was seven when her family was murdered. Twenty-five years later, she's forced to confront the dark secrets of her past.

title: The Big Sleep
author: Raymond Chandler
description: Philip Marlowe, a hard-boiled private investigator, is hired to handle a blackmail case, which quickly spirals into something much more complex and dangerous.

title: The Maltese Falcon
author: Dashiell Hammett
description: Sam Spade, a private detective in San Francisco, gets entangled in a case involving a valuable statue, a femme fatale, and a host of shady characters.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island and systematically killed off one by one. A classic whodunit by the queen of crime.

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Sherlock Holmes investigates the legend of a supernatural hound that haunts the Baskerville family.

title: The Girl Who Played with Fire
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Lisbeth Salander and Mikael Blomkvist investigate a double murder with dangerous implications.

title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
author: Alexander McCall Smith
description: Precious Ramotswe, Botswana’s first female detective, solves intriguing cases with wisdom and wit.

title: Farewell, My Lovely
author: Raymond Chandler
description: Philip Marlowe stumbles upon a case involving a missing nightclub singer, a dangerous gangster, and a string of murders in Los Angeles.

title: The Woman in White
author: Wilkie Collins
description: A mysterious woman in white warns of a dark conspiracy, leading drawing master Walter Hartright into a complex case of deception and intrigue.

title: The Daughter of Time
author: Josephine Tey
description: Bedridden Inspector Alan Grant investigates the historical case of King Richard III, questioning whether he was truly guilty of murder.

title: A Study in Scarlet
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson investigate a mysterious murder that leads to a shocking revelation.

title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
author: John le Carré
description: A classic Cold War espionage novel featuring British intelligence officer George Smiley.

title: The Bourne Identity
author: Robert Ludlum
description: A thrilling story of a man suffering from amnesia who must discover his true identity while evading assassins.

title: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
author: John le Carré
description: A tense and realistic espionage novel about a British agent sent on a dangerous mission.

title: Red Sparrow
author: Jason Matthews
description: A former ballerina is trained to be a Russian spy and must navigate a world of deception and intrigue.

title: I Am Pilgrim
author: Terry Hayes
description: A fast-paced espionage thriller following a covert intelligence agent on a high-stakes mission.

title: The Hunt for Red October
author: Tom Clancy
description: A high-stakes Cold War thriller where a Soviet submarine commander tries to defect to the U.S. while being pursued by both American and Soviet forces.

title: Our Man in Havana
author: Graham Greene
description: A vacuum cleaner salesman in Cuba is recruited by British Intelligence, leading to a humorous yet dangerous adventure of mistaken identities and false reports.

title: The Day of the Jackal
author: Frederick Forsyth
description: A professional assassin is hired to kill the French president, leading to an intense manhunt across Europe to stop him before it's too late.

title: The Key to Rebecca
author: Ken Follett
description: Set during World War II, a German spy operating in Egypt must be stopped by a British officer before he delivers critical intelligence to the Nazis.

title: Agent Running in the Field
author: John le Carré
description: A veteran British spy is drawn into a dangerous game of international espionage as he uncovers a conspiracy that threatens global stability.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A dark tale of vanity and corruption, where a young man’s portrait ages and reveals his sins while he remains unnaturally youthful.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping historical novel that intertwines the lives of aristocrats, soldiers, and peasants during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring themes of fate, love, and war.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where Big Brother watches everything, challenging themes of freedom and truth.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A tale of obsession, revenge, and the sea, following Captain Ahab's pursuit of the great white whale.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream, set in the Roaring Twenties, focusing on Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story of racial injustice and moral growth, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch in the Deep South during the 1930s.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic horror novel about a young scientist, Victor Frankenstein, who creates a sentient creature, leading to tragic consequences and deep philosophical questions.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A chilling tale of Count Dracula's attempt to spread his undead curse from Transylvania to England, facing resistance from a determined group of vampire hunters.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological thriller about a poor ex-student who commits a crime to test his moral theories, only to be haunted by guilt and psychological turmoil.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that explores themes of love, class, and social expectations in Regency-era England.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A mysterious and magical competition between two young illusionists unfolds within the confines of a black-and-white striped circus that appears only at night.

title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A man returns to his childhood home for a funeral and finds himself drawn back to the magical and dangerous world he discovered as a boy.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An Andalusian shepherd boy named Santiago travels from Spain to Egypt in search of a treasure buried near the Pyramids.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high fantasy trilogy following the journey of a hobbit named Frodo Baggins as he sets out to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction series following the misadventures of Arthur Dent as he travels through space after Earth is destroyed.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A poetic and philosophical tale about a pilot who meets a young prince from another planet.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational saga of the Buendía family and their mythical town of Macondo.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set in Nazi Germany, this novel tells the story of Liesel, a girl who finds solace in books and shares them with others during a time of great turmoil.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young boy named Pi survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger, leading to a story of survival, faith, and the power of storytelling.

title: Big Nate: From The Top
author: Lincoln Peirce
description: Nate Wright is eleven years old, four-and-a-half feet tall, and the all-time record holder for school detentions in school history. He's a self-described genius and sixth-grade Renaissance man.

title: Dog Man: Unleashed
author: Dav Pilkey
description: A hilarious graphic novel series following Dog Man, a heroic half-dog, half-human cop who fights crime while struggling with his canine instincts.

title: Garfield
author: Jim Davis
description: A fun-filled collection of comics featuring Garfield, the lazy and sarcastic cat.

title: Archie Comics: 80 Years of Classic Comics
author: Various Authors
description: A nostalgic collection of classic Archie Comics, following the fun and drama of Archie, Betty, Veronica, Jughead, and the rest of Riverdale.

title: Calvin and Hobbes
author: Bill Watterson
description: A beloved comic strip following the adventures of Calvin, a mischievous six-year-old boy, and his stuffed tiger, Hobbes, who comes to life in his imagination.

title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
author: Jeff Kinney
description: The hilarious journey of Greg Heffley, a middle schooler, navigating life with his family and friends.

title: Batman: The Killing Joke
author: Alan Moore
description: A dark and thought-provoking graphic novel exploring the origins of the Joker and his relationship with Batman.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: On the desert planet Arrakis, the only source of the valuable spice melange, a young man named Paul Atreides is thrust into a complex world of politics, religion, and ecology.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: Seconds before Earth is demolished to make way for a hyperspace bypass, Arthur Dent is rescued by his friend Ford Prefect, who has been posing as a human for the last fifteen years.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: In the realm of Westeros, nine noble families fight for control over the Seven Kingdoms, and an ancient threat awakens in the icy North.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: On his eleventh birthday, Harry Potter discovers that he is a wizard and is invited to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: Told in his own words, Kvothe recounts the tale of his life as a child prodigy, a wandering performer, a university student, and a fugitive.

title: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: In a world where storms of incredible power lay waste to the landscape, a broken and disillusioned soldier, a young slave girl, and a brilliant but disgraced scholar are bound together by fate.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A human emissary is sent to the planet Winter, a world where people are neither male nor female, but can shift between genders.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A psychohistorian predicts the imminent collapse of the Galactic Empire and establishes a Foundation to preserve human knowledge and rebuild civilization.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut is stranded on Mars and must use his ingenuity and scientific knowledge to survive until a rescue mission can reach him.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A gripping novel about a young girl growing up in isolation, blending mystery, romance, and nature writing.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A thought-provoking novel about a woman who explores parallel lives in a magical library after attempting suicide.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: A compelling story of twin sisters who live in two very different worlds, examining race and identity.

title: The Four Winds
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A powerful historical fiction novel set during the Great Depression, following a woman’s fight for survival.

title: The House of Flame and Shadow
author: Sarah J. Maas
description: The third book in the Crescent City series, mixing high fantasy with thrilling action.

title: Iron Flame
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The sequel to Fourth Wing, continuing the saga of dragons, romance, and war.

title: None of This is True
author: Lisa Jewell
description: A psychological thriller where a podcast interview turns into a deadly game of manipulation.

title: Onyx Storm
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third installment in The Empyrean series, blending romance and fantasy in a dragon-filled world.
